intro: Tithymalus nicaeensis, commonly known as the Nicaean tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
